The volume of water to be added to \(100 \mathrm{~cm}^{3}\) of \(0.5 \mathrm{~N} \mathrm{H}_{2} \mathrm{SO}_{4}\) to get decinormal concentration is:
How many grams of \(2.0 \mathrm{M} \mathrm{CH}_{3} \mathrm{OH}\) would have to be added to water to prepare \(150 \mathrm{ml}\) of its solution?

q_option: When the gas is not highly soluble
When the gas reacts chemically with the solvent
1.q_string: In which of the following cases is Henry's law valid?

q_option: Due to non-volatile solute, relative lowering of vapour pressure of a solution is equal to the mole fraction of the solute in solution.
Vapour pressure of solution is directly proportional to the mole fraction of the solvent.
Two sucrose solutions of same molality prepared in different solvents will have the same freezing point depression
Relative lowering of vapour pressure for a particular solution is independent of temperature.
1.q_string:
Directions: The following question has four choices out of which ONLY ONE is correct.

Which of the following statements contradicts Raoult's law?

q_option: The interaction between the components is similar to that in the pure components.
There is no enthalpy change on mixing.
There is no volume change on mixing.
Their components show positive and negative deviations from Raoult's law.
1.q_string: Which of the following properties represents a non-ideal solution?

Ethylene dibromide \(\left(\mathrm{C}_{2} \mathrm{H}_{4} \mathrm{Br}_{2}\right)\) and 1,2 - dibromopropane \(\left(\mathrm{C}_{3} \mathrm{H}_{6} \mathrm{Br}_{2}\right)\) forms a series of ideal solution over the whole range of composition. At \(85^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\), the vapour pressure of these pure liquids are are \(183 \mathrm{mmHg}\) and \(127 \mathrm{~mm} \mathrm{Hg}\) respectively.

\(10 \mathrm{gm}\) of ethylene dibromide is dissolved in \(80 \mathrm{gm}\) of 1,2 - dibromo - propane. Calculate the partial pressures of each components and the total pressure of the solution at \(85^{\circ} \mathrm{C}\).

Calculate the composition of vapour in equilibrium with the above and express as mole fraction of ethylene dibromide.

Which one of the following aqueous solutions will exhibit the highest boiling point?

q_option: Boiling point of glucose solution is more than that of KCl solution.
Freezing point of glucose solution will be less than that of KCl.
Osmotic pressure of glucose solution will be less than that of KCl solution.
Lowering of vapour pressure of both the solutions is identical.
